newsitem.title: USA: CalEnergy arm closes $400 mln credit facility.
newsitem.headline: CalEnergy arm closes $400 mln credit facility.

text.p: CalEnergy Co Inc said Thursday its CE Indonesia Funding Corp subsidiary closed a $400 million revolving credit facility to finance the development and construction of CalEnergy's geothermal power facilities at the Dieng and Patuha sites in Indonesia.
The facility is non-recourse to CalEnergy, it added.
The $400 million facility was arranged by Credit Suisse First Boston and will be provided by a syndicate of international commercial banks.

"The $400 million revolving credit facility will provide flexibility in financing construction and development of our Indonesian projects, and the financing structure contemplates subsequent capital market investment grade debt issuances by CE Indonesia Funding Corp...as units are placed into commercial operation," David Sokol, chairman, said in a statement.
